executable.title: Endoscopy
executable.description: Provides interactive animation of flythrough paths.
executable.acknowledgements: This work is supported by PAR-07-249: R01CA131718 NA-MIC Virtual Colonoscopy (See http://www.na-mic.org/Wiki/index.php/NA-MIC_NCBC_Collaboration:NA-MIC_virtual_colonoscopy) NA-MIC, NAC, BIRN, NCIGT, and the Slicer Community. See http://www.slicer.org for details. Module implemented by Steve Pieper.

parameters.label: Path
parameters.description: Inputs related to defining the path.

integer.name: Camera
integer.description: The input camera that will be controlled by the path.
integer.label: Camera

integer.name: Input Fiducials
integer.description: The list of control points defining the path.
integer.label: Input Fiducials

integer.name: Create Path
integer.description: Create a path model as an interpolation of the currently selected points. Will enable the Flythrough panel.
integer.label: Create Path

parameters.label: Flythrough
parameters.description: Controls for animating along the path.

integer.name: Frame
integer.description: The current frame (step along the path).
integer.label: Frame

integer.name: Frame Skip
integer.description: Number of frames to skip (larger numbers make the animation go faster).
integer.label: Frame Skip

integer.name: Frame Delay
integer.description: Time delay between animation frames (larger numbers make the animation go slower)
integer.label: Frame Delay

integer.name: View Angle
integer.description: Field of view of the camera. The default value of 30 approximates normal camera lenses. Larger numbers, such as 110 or 120 approximate the wide angle lenses often used in endoscopy viewing systems.
integer.label: View Angle

integer.name: Play/Stop
integer.description: Field of view of the camera. The default value of 30 approximates normal camera lenses. Larger numbers, such as 110 or 120 approximate the wide angle lenses often used in endoscopy viewing systems.
integer.label: Play/Stop
